titleStmt.title: Description of Library Company, 12 vol. 1: Book of Hours, Use of Paris

notesStmt.note: Calendar is in French; some calendar leaves are misbound

Faye, C.U., continued and edited by W.H. Bond, Supplement to the Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada (New York: Bibliographical Society of America, 1962), p. 468, no. 12.

msContents.summary: This small late-fifteenth-century Book of Hours, bound in two volumes at a much later date, displays the damage characteristic of parchment books that have been exposed to fire (the parchment is wrinkled and shrunk around the edges). This is the first volume, which contains a Calendar, the Gospel Lessons, the Obsecro te, and the Hours of the Virgin of the Use of Paris.

msItem.title: Book of Hours, Use of Paris
Hours of the Virgin, beginning and end lacking

supportDesc.extent: iii+71+iv; 110 x 76 mm bound to 121 x 81 mm

layoutDesc.layout: One column of fourteen lines, ruled in lead; written area: 72 x 57 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Four-line illuminated initials at some chapter divisions, small illuminated initials and line-endings throughout

binding.p: Nineteenth-century half vellum with paper sides

history.provenance: Loganian Library (later the Library Company of Philadelphia)
